intro: Thesium ussanguense, commonly known as the Brazilian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, grass-like appearance. The plant produces striking, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and yellow, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Thesium ussanguense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates.
